intro: Cyanea feddei, commonly known as the Fedde's cyanea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Cyanea feddei is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
